greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of k-partite partitions of {n}^k into k-tuples; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: A(n,k) is the number of factorizations of m^n where m is a product of k distinct primes.  A(2,2) = 9: (2*3)^2 = 36 has 9 factorizations: 36, 3*12, 4*9, 3*3*4, 2*18, 6*6, 2*3*6, 2*2*9, 2*2*3*3.
A(n,k) is the number of (n*k) X k matrices with nonnegative integer entries and column sums n up to permutation of rows. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Dec 10 2018
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..209
program: D(p, n, k)={my(v=vector(n)); for(i=1, #p, v[p[i]]++); EulerT(v)[n]^k/prod(i=1, #v, i^v[i]*v[i]!)}
T(n, k)={my(m=n*k, q=Vec(exp(O(x*x^m) + intformal((x^n-1)/(1-x)))/(1-x))); if(n==0, 1, sum(j=0, m, my(s=0); forpart(p=j, s+=D(p,n,k), [1,n]); s*q[#q-j]))} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Dec 11 2018
xref: Cf. A188392, A219585 (partitions of {n}^k into distinct k-tuples), A256384, A318284, A318951.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 26 2012
